primary_trope.name: countdown
primary_trope.hook_text: Where Tour de Nebraska breaks you

beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: Here's where Tour de Nebraska breaks you. 250 mi. Zone by zone.
beats.text_on_screen: Tour de Nebraska — Where It Hurts
beats.visual: Full route map, then zoom into first zone
beats.editing_note: Start with full route visible, then rapid zoom in. Ominous music hit. Avatar suffering face.

beats.label: ZONE 1: Mile 41
beats.narration: Mile 41. Curtis to Elwood Reality Check. Day one's 41 miles introduce you to Nebraska's signature lie. there are no flat roads.
beats.text_on_screen: MILE 41: Curtis to Elwood Reality Check
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Mix of paved roads and gravel; optional gravel adventure includes single-lane maintenance roads, fresh gravel, and minimum maintenance roads (MMR)

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 1 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 2: Mile 76
beats.narration: Mile 76. Cambridge Approach Grind. Day two's gravel adventure component kicks in with single-lane maintenance roads that look manageable until you hit.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Mix of paved roads and gravel; optional gravel adventure includes single-lane maintenance roads, fresh gravel, and minimum maintenance roads (MMR)

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 2 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 3: Mile 135
beats.narration: Mile 135. McCook Marathon. Day three's 59-mile push to McCook includes the challenging climbs along Middle Creek Road and West Lake Drive.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Mix of paved roads and gravel; optional gravel adventure includes single-lane maintenance roads, fresh gravel, and minimum maintenance roads (MMR)

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 3 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 4: Mile 191
beats.narration: Mile 191. Optional Loop Punishment. The 56-mile optional loop on day four separates tourists from masochists. Fresh gravel sections combined with accumulated.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Mix of paved roads and gravel; optional gravel adventure includes single-lane maintenance roads, fresh gravel, and minimum maintenance roads (MMR)

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 4 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 5: Mile 231
beats.narration: Mile 231. Curtis Homecoming Crawl. The final 40 miles back to Curtis feel longer than the previous four days combined.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Mix of paved roads and gravel; optional gravel adventure includes single-lane maintenance roads, fresh gravel, and minimum maintenance roads (MMR)

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 5 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red). [RIFF HERE] after final zone reveal.

beats.label: CTA + LOOP
beats.narration: Full suffering breakdown on the site. Link in bio.
beats.visual: Full map with all zones lit up
beats.editing_note: Loop design: end with zoomed-out map that connects back to the opening frame.
beats.engagement_question: Which zone would end your race? Comment the mile marker.

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style cartoon cyclist in agony, route map background, red zone markers, 'Tour de Nebraska' text --ar 9:16 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.tiktok: Post natively. Design for loop replay. Trending audio optional.
cross_platform_notes.instagram_reels: Same cut. Add location tag for race area.
cross_platform_notes.youtube_shorts: Same cut. Pin comment with link to full breakdown.
cross_platform_notes.twitter_x: Post thumbnail still + hot take as tweet text.

production_checklist: [ ] B-roll sourced (check broll_sources in each beat)
[ ] Music track selected (check BPM targets per beat)
[ ] Loop point tested (final frame → opening frame)
[ ] Test 3-second hold rate with fresh eyes
